contentrichtext.text: [[File:Maasai man, Eastern Serengeti, October 2006.jpg|thumb|right|240px|[[Maasai people|Maasai]] man, [[Serengeti|Eastern Serengeti]].]] {{two other uses||the German publishers|Herder publishers|the German poet and philosopher|Johann Gottfried Herder}} A '''herder''' is a worker who lives a possibly semi-[[nomad]]ic life, caring for various domestic [[animal]]s, in places where these animals wander [[pasture]] lands. Usually if the person is a minor, he is called '''herdboy''', if adult sometimes by contrast '''herdsman'''.<ref>{{cite news | first=Alexandra | last=Brooks | coauthors= | title=26 farm workers to receive long service awards | date=2003-06-19 | publisher=The Breezi Publishing Company Ltd | url =http://www.farminguk.com/index.asp?show=newsArticle&id=607&country= | work =FarmingUK | pages = | accessdate = 2007-08-20 | language = }}</ref> Because their work is necessarily mostly outdoors, they move around from place to place in the course of their labours. The possibility exists that the lands upon which their beasts graze are not claimed as any single person's [[property]]. A number of [[romanticism|romantic]] [[mythology|legends]] have sprung up around some aspects of their way of life. Some herders whose lifestyles have become mainstays of [[fiction]] include: * The [[shepherd]], featured in [[pastoral]] literature * The [[cowboy]], hero of [[Western movie]]s and fiction, featured in romantic tales from the [[United States]] * The [[gaucho]], who in the [[Rio Grande do Sul|Southernmost Brazil]] and [[Argentina]] plays a similar role to the cowboy. ==Other names== * A [[Campino]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rtribatejo.org/galeriadesc.asp?tipo=Festa%20Brava |title=Pictures of campinos, from the Ribatejo tourism office |publisher=Rtribatejo.org |date= |accessdate=2011-12-25}}</ref> is a [[cattle]] herder in the [[portugal|Portuguese]] region of [[Ribatejo Province|Ribatejo]]. ==See also== {{Wiktionary}} {{Commons category|Herders}} * [[Cowboy]] * [[Goatherd]] * [[Herding]] * [[Pastoralism]] * [[Shepherd]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Mounted stock herders}} [[Category:Agricultural occupations (animal)]] {{agri-stub}}
